qas.question: What modern, mass-produced weapon were the French infantry provided?
What was the maximum effective range of the Chassepot rifle?
In which type of warfare did the French best utilize the Chassepot?
What precedent of the machine gun did the French troops also possess?
On what was the mitrailleuse mounted?

context: French infantry were equipped with the breech-loading <a0_0>Chassepot rifle<a0_0/>, one of the most modern mass-produced firearms in the world at the time. With a rubber ring seal and a smaller bullet, the Chassepot had a maximum effective range of some <a1_0>1,500 metres (4,900 ft)<a1_0/> with a short reloading time. French tactics emphasised the defensive use of the Chassepot rifle in <a2_0>trench-warfare<a2_0/> style fighting—the so-called feu de bataillon. The artillery was equipped with rifled, muzzle-loaded La Hitte guns. The army also possessed a precursor to the machine-gun: <a3_0>the mitrailleuse<a3_0/>, which could unleash significant, concentrated firepower but nevertheless lacked range and was comparatively immobile, and thus prone to being easily overrun. The mitrailleuse was mounted <a4_0>on an artillery gun carriage<a4_0/> and grouped in batteries in a similar fashion to cannon.
